intro: Tithymalus dulcis subsp. incomptus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved tithymalus, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit and finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. This subspecies is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats across its native range in Europe and parts of Asia.
